meanings.definition: A movement or activity of an organism in response to a stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The kineses of the cat chasing a butterfly were swift and playful.
meanings.sent2: The kineses of the dancers on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The kineses of the squirrel trying to reach the bird feeder were comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her kineses on the soccer field were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The kineses of the cheetah running at top speed were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The ability to move or be moved.
meanings.sent1: The robot's kineses were programmed to perform specific tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The bird's kineses allowed it to soar gracefully through the sky.
meanings.sent3: The toy car's kineses made it seem almost alive as it zoomed around the room.
meanings.sent4: His kineses in the gym showed his strength and agility.
meanings.sent5: The kineses of the leaves in the wind created a mesmerizing dance.
